data.title: News
data.meta_description: Stay up to date with the latest stories from the Faculty of Arts & Science at the University of Toronto.
data.text:
For more than a decade, the Toronto Outdoor Picture Show (TOPS) has been a staple of the city's summer scene. Whether it’s a cultural touchstone film or something more obscure, the screenings bring thousands of people together. And it’s all thanks to Arts & Science alum Emily Reid.

From the energy resource promise of hydrogen buried beneath Earth’s surface to teenage girls as the leading drivers of language change, experts from a range of disciplines across the Faculty of Arts & Science are sharing their expertise on a variety of issues in the media.

Here’s some of what they had to say this week.

As of this writing, it’s estimated that one third of the historic Alberta town of Jasper has been destroyed by wildfire activity. Tragedies of this nature are becoming ever more common in Canada, due in large part to record-high temperatures and drought conditions caused by climate change.

For A&S alum Christian Sood and his family, chemistry is foundational. Appreciation for the subject and for his time at U of T inspired Sood and his family to create the Dr.

From corporations offering carbon offsets to manage brand reputation, to the impact of rising rents on the viability of small businesses in Toronto, experts from a range of disciplines across the Faculty of Arts & Science are sharing their expertise on a variety of issues in the media.
